text: with the nomination of Sonia Sotomayor
the battle for her confirmation began I
was just counseled not to be nervous
that's almost impossible her record and
past are going to be dissected in the
coming months and a lot of the energy
will likely surround a now notorious
video clip Court of Appeals is where
policy is made and i know and i know
this is on tape and i should never say
that because we don't make law I know
certainly unfortunate language and she
shouldn't be making those kind of
comments no judge of it should make
those kind of comments because i think
the totality of of the record is one
that's more important to look at lawyers
that i talked to are appalled by the
concept that you would have a judge
using empathy as a basis to render

american people learned more about me
they will see that i am an ordinary
person Republicans on Capitol Hill are
beginning to dig through her record and

have been on television to support her
outside groups will be important friends
and foes for the White House as the
process moves forward many friends were
in attendance at the announcement from
civil rights to women's groups to unions
but conservative groups may end up being
more energized the judicial confirmation
Network which was initially organized to
support President Bush's nominees
produced a video slamming his Sotomayor
before she was even nominee
America deserves better we think that
first of all by engaging the American
people in this debate we can have a big
impact we want these senators to go on
record up or down and that take those
issues back to their voters back to the
American people who can hold them
accountable for their view of the
Supreme Court in 2010 and in 2012
barring any surprises there are a few
reasons to think that ms Sotomayor will
not in the end get confirmed one
question is how long it will take the I
think the average is about 72 days we
probably got a 90 day plus road to go
